title.rendered: Heather Matthews Named One of the UK’s Top 8 Female Business Leaders

content.rendered:
Celebrating Visionary Leadership and Empowering Women in Business

We are delighted to announce that our Managing Director, Heather Matthews, has been shortlisted as one of the Top 8 Female Business Leaders in the UK at the prestigious British Business Awards 2025. This recognition highlights Heather’s outstanding leadership at Little’s Chauffeur Drive and her significant impact on the industry.

Recognition of Female Business Leaders

Heather joins an incredible lineup of finalists in her category. The finalists include Vikki Jackson-Smith (J&B Recycling), Brenda McLeish (Learning Curve Group), Dr Poonam Gupta OBE (PG Paper), Helen Watson (Rothschild & Co), Jen Mair (Martin Currie), Lesley Larg (Thorntons), and Charlotte Stagg and Jessica Lancaster (Cocopup). This celebration of visionary leadership and the empowerment of women in business highlights the outstanding achievements of all nominees. With over 300 businesses entering the awards, being shortlisted is an incredible achievement and a testament to Heather’s leadership.

The British Business Awards 2025

The British Business Awards celebrate excellence across multiple industries, with 143 companies across 18 categories competing for top honours. Finalists range from global giants like Dell Technologies and Hewlett Packard to UK leaders including Scottish Power, Greggs, and The Weir Group. The winners will be announced during the ceremony on the 24th of April 2025, attended by over 2,000 business leaders.

The event will also feature an exclusive fireside chat and a special musical performance from legendary musician Sting, alongside a keynote speech from Sir Bob Geldof, celebrating the 40th anniversary of Band Aid. The evening will be hosted by comedian and presenter Rob Brydon.

Heather Matthews on Her Nomination

Heather shared her thoughts on this incredible recognition:

“Being shortlisted for Female Business Leader of the Year at the British Business Awards is an incredible moment – not just for me, but for the entire team at Little’s. To be recognised among such well-respected companies and inspiring leaders across the UK is both humbling and exhilarating. This nomination is a testament to the power of passion, perseverance, and the unwavering dedication we bring to our industry every day. I’m looking forward to celebrating with my fellow nominees and championing the brilliant women driving British business forward.”

Leading the Way at Little’s Chauffeur Drive

Under Heather’s leadership, Little’s continues to set the standard for excellence in luxury transport, offering five-star chauffeur services globally. Her commitment to exceptional service, sustainability, and innovation has propelled the company to new heights.

Supporting a Greater Cause

Beyond celebrating business excellence, the awards also support Social Bite, a charity dedicated to tackling homelessness. The event aims to raise £1 million, with a special fundraising lunch hosted in partnership with Gleneagles Hotel.

We are incredibly proud of Heather and look forward to the awards ceremony in April. Regardless of the outcome, this recognition reaffirms the strength of female leadership in business and the impact of inspiring leaders like Heather.

For more information on the British Business Awards 2025, visit: www.britishbusinessawards.co.uk.
